definitions.definition: the place where two or more roads or railway lines meet

examples.text: It was near the junction of City Road and Old Street.
Come off the motorway at junction 6.
The most complicated motorway interchange in Britain is known as Spaghetti Junction.
In the 19th century the town became an important railway junction.

definitions.definition: a place where two or more cables, rivers or other things meet or are joined

examples.text: the junction between nerves and muscles

wordOrigin: early 18th cent. (originally meaning the action or fact of being joined): from Latin junctio(n-), from jungere ‘to join’.
